item.description:
及时了解市场监测情况

Get up to speed with what the markets are monitoring

item.title: 尼日利亚货币为何反弹及其对经济的意义
item.description: 尼日利亚每天抽取近 150 万桶石油，是非洲大陆最大的产油国。然而，这个石油美元国家却一再面临硬通货短缺的问题，经济因此陷入困境。2023 年 5 月上任的博拉-蒂努布总统已着手整顿该国的外汇市场并吸引投资，但这一过程一直磕磕绊绊。本币奈拉的贬值刺激了通货膨胀，央行的反应是大幅提高借贷成本。【原文：Nigeria pumps almost 1.5 million barrels of oil a day, making it the continent’s biggest producer. Yet this petrodollar nation faces repeated shortages of hard currency that choke its economy. President Bola Tinubu, who took office in May 2023, has moved to overhaul the country’s foreign-exchange market and attract investment, but the process has been bumpy. The devaluation of the local naira currency stoked inflation, and the central bank reacted by sharply increasing borrowing costs — at the r】

item.title: 当美联储最喜欢的指标也停止下跌时
item.description:
为适应美国无法减息而其他央行又面临减息压力的现实，各国央行正争先恐后地进行调整。【原文：

The scramble to adjust to a reality where the US can’t cut and other central banks are under pressure to is on.

】

item.title: 香港交易所提出为现金交易设立多家结算银行的计划
item.description: 投资者可能很快就会获准为其在香港交易及结算所有限公司（Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing Ltd.）进行的现金股票和期权交易选择一家以上的结算银行。【原文：Investors may soon be allowed to enlist more than one clearing bank for their cash equities and options trades on the Hong Kong Exchanges & Clearing Ltd.】

item.title: 曼哈顿公寓租金下降显示市场稳定
item.description: 曼哈顿的公寓租金在连续数月上涨后，3 月份出人意料地出现了下降，但这不太可能是市场疲软的迹象。【原文：Manhattan apartment rents unexpectedly declined in March after months of increases, though it’s unlikely to be a sign of a softening market.】

item.title: 欧洲央行将按兵不动，首次降息锁定在 6 月：决策指南
item.description: 欧洲中央银行将在第五次会议上继续搁置借贷成本，同时进一步为 6 月份开始的削减做好准备。【原文：The European Central Bank is set to keep borrowing costs on hold for a fifth meeting while further readying the ground for cuts to begin in June.】

item.title: 产能过剩导致中国太阳能硅产量降至 2020 年以来最低水平
item.description: 由于产能过剩和激烈竞争导致整个行业利润减少，中国的太阳能硅价格跌至三年来的最低点。【原文：Solar silicon prices in China plunged to a three-year low as overcapacity and fierce competition slash profits across the industry.】

item.title: 乐天成本高昂的垃圾债券预示着日本亿万富翁三木谷将面临挑战
item.description: 在连续五年亏损之后，亿万富翁三木谷浩史（Hiroshi Mikitani）的乐天集团（Rakuten Group Inc.事实证明，这样做的代价是昂贵的。【原文：After five straight years of losses, billionaire Hiroshi Mikitani’s Rakuten Group Inc. is trying to bounce back from a move into mobile that cost it billions of dollars. Doing so is proving expensive.】

item.title: 习近平与马英九会面，中台贸易数据显示分歧日益扩大
item.description: 中国领导人习近平和台湾前总统马英九刚刚通过一次具有里程碑意义的会晤，强调了海峡两岸亲如一家的观点。但贸易数据却告诉我们一个不同的故事。【原文：Chinese leader Xi Jinping and former Taiwan President Ma Ying-jeou just used a landmark meeting to underscore their view that the two sides of the strait are close as family. Trade data tell a different story.】

item.title: 中国城市进一步放宽购房政策以刺激销售
item.description: 由于长期的销售低迷给经济和房地产开发商造成了沉重的压力，中国地方政府正在加紧放宽住房市场的规定。【原文：China’s local governments are stepping up the easing of rules for their housing markets, as a protracted sales slump weighs on the economy and real estate developers.】

item.title: 淡马锡斥资 180 亿美元进军欧洲，瞄准富裕家族企业
item.description: 淡马锡控股私人有限公司（Temasek Holdings Pte）计划加大在欧洲的投资力度，该公司新任当地负责人预计，欧洲的挫折将为这家新加坡国有投资者带来重大机遇。【原文：Temasek Holdings Pte plans to ramp up investment in Europe, undeterred by setbacks in a region that its new local chief expects will provide significant opportunities for the Singapore state investor.】

item.title: 中东紧张局势抵消通胀热度，黄金重拾涨势
item.description: 由于中东紧张局势加剧，抵消了美联储今年降息幅度将低于预期的担忧，黄金重拾涨势。【原文：Gold resumed its blistering rally as heightened tensions in the Middle East offset concerns that the Federal Reserve will cut interest rates less than expected this year.】

item.title: 中国加大对人民币的支持力度，定盘价创下历史最高纪录
item.description: 由于美元的广泛走强使人民币接近政策禁区，中国发出了继续支持本国货币的信号。【原文：China signaled continued support for its currency as broad strength in the dollar kept the yuan close to a policy no-go area.】

item.title: 韩国央行将在大选后过渡期间维持利率不变
item.description: 预计韩国央行周五将维持其政策设置不变，在韩国经历重大政治变革以及两名董事会成员准备退出之际，韩国央行将选择继续以稳定的方式对抗通胀。【原文：The Bank of Korea is expected to keep its policy settings unchanged Friday, opting to continue its inflation fight in a steady manner as the nation undergoes a major political change and two of the bank’s board members prepare to exit.】

item.title: 澳大利亚储蓄计划在四年内将私募股权投资资产翻一番
item.description: 澳大利亚最大的养老基金 AustralianSuper 计划在未来四年内将其私募股权投资资产几乎翻一番，因为在借贷成本上升的刺激下，私募股权投资交易逐渐回暖。【原文：AustralianSuper, the country’s largest pension fund, plans to almost double its private equity assets over the next four years as deals pick up following a lull spurred by higher borrowing costs.】

item.title: 亚洲股市因 CPI 而遭抛售，交易员对日元干预保持警惕
item.description: 据分析师和策略师称，周三美国通胀数据快于预期，亚洲股市可能因此承压，而货币交易员将关注日元可能受到的干预。【原文：Asian stocks are likely to be under pressure after Wednesday’s faster-than-expected US inflation data, while currency traders will be on watch for possible yen intervention, according to analysts and strategists】

item.title: 日本基准收益率因美国国债收益率下跌而创下五个月新高
item.description: 在美国通胀率飙升引发国债市场溃败之后，日本 10 年期国债收益率攀升至 11 月以来的最高点，日元暴跌也增加了日本央行收紧政策的压力。【原文：The yield on Japan’s 10-year government bond climbed to its highest since November after a jump in US inflation set off a rout in Treasuries, and a slump in the yen added pressure on the Bank of Japan to tighten policy.】

item.title: 执政党选举失利导致韩国股市和韩元下跌
item.description: 韩国总统尹锡烈的政党在议会选举中遭遇重大损失，这很可能对其保守的资本市场议程造成打击，随后韩国股市下跌。【原文：South Korean stocks fell after President Yoon Suk Yeol’s party suffered a significant loss in parliamentary elections, likely dealing a blow to his conservative capital market agenda.】

item.title: 日元暴跌后日本外汇局局长警告不排除任何选项
item.description: 在日元对美元汇率跌至 1990 年以来的最低水平后，日本最高货币官员警告说，日本当局将考虑外汇市场的所有选择，并随时准备应对任何事件。【原文：Japan’s top currency official warned that authorities will consider all their options for the foreign exchange market and are ready to respond to any event after the yen fell to its lowest level versus the dollar since 1990.】

item.title: 石油保持升势，交易商为伊朗打击以色列做好准备
item.description: 由于交易商在关注伊朗或其代理人可能对以色列发动的袭击，这可能会引发中东敌对行动的大幅升级，石油保持了三个交易日以来的首次上涨。【原文：Oil held the first gain in three sessions as traders watched for a potential attack on Israel by Iran or its proxies, which could spark a significant escalation of hostilities in the Middle East.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。高盛上调中国经济增长前景。日元进一步暴跌。美国通胀意外上行。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. Goldman raises China growth outlook. The yen plunges further. US inflation surprises to the upside. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 养老院公司 PACS 集团首次公开募股融资 4.5 亿美元
item.description: 据一位熟悉内情的人士透露，PACS 集团公司在首次公开募股中募集了 4.5 亿美元，股票定价在市场范围的中间点，并增加了售出股票的数量。【原文：PACS Group Inc. raised $450 million in an initial public offering, pricing its shares at the mid-point of a marketed range and increasing the number of shares sold, according to a person familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 德国可能是欧洲第一季度盈利的致命弱点
item.description: 未来几周，德国少数几家顶级工业企业可能会成为拖累欧洲季度业绩的最大因素，这对徘徊在历史最高点附近的德国基准 DAX 指数来说是一个不祥之兆。【原文：A handful of top German industrials may prove the biggest drag on quarterly results in Europe in the coming weeks, an ominous sign for the country’s benchmark DAX Index as it hovers near a record high.】

item.title: 英国测量师对购房需求的乐观程度为 13 个月来最高
item.description: 在抵押贷款利率下降和经济形势好转有助于稳定房价之后，英国房地产测量师对新买家需求的乐观程度达到了 13 个月以来的最高水平。【原文：UK property surveyors are the most optimistic they’ve been in 13 months about new buyer demand after falling mortgage rates and a rosier economic picture helped stabilize house prices.】

item.title: 银行家发现香港收购成倍增长的一个亮点
item.description: 交易活动的放缓让香港的银行家们疲于奔命，但有一个领域却热闹非凡：对在香港证券交易所上市的公司进行收购。【原文：A slowdown in dealmaking activity has left bankers in Hong Kong scrapping for business, yet one area is buzzing: buyouts of companies listed on the city’s stock exchange.】

item.title: 中国投资者抢购铜金股票，推动股价上涨 10
item.description: 中国投资者正在抢购与从铜到金等高价金属相关的股票，从而帮助面临着巩固新生反弹的艰苦战斗的在岸市场。【原文：Chinese investors are snapping up stocks tied to high-flying metals from copper to gold, aiding an onshore market facing an uphill battle to cement a nascent rebound.】

item.title: 美国CPI再创新高，亚洲股市将下跌：市场综述
item.description: 由于美国通胀数据高于预期，支持了美联储可能在更长时间内维持较高利率的观点，亚洲股市早盘开始下跌。【原文：Stocks in Asia are primed for early declines after higher-than-expected US inflation data supported the view the Federal Reserve may keep interest rates higher for longer.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚领导人经马杜罗同意会见委内瑞拉反对党候选人
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-彼得罗（Gustavo Petro）在对加拉加斯的旋风式访问中会见了委内瑞拉反对党总统候选人曼努埃尔-罗萨莱斯（Manuel Rosales）。【原文：Colombia’s Gustavo Petro met with Venezuela’s opposition presidential candidate Manuel Rosales during a whirlwind visit to Caracas as he positions himself as a mediator in the political crisis that has engulfed the neighboring country, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 全球外汇交易商与美元一样受人民币摆布
item.description: 一些策略师认为，呼吁中国政府放松对受困人民币的控制的中国观察家们需要注意，这样做有可能引发连锁反应，撼动新兴市场和发达市场的货币。【原文：China watchers calling for Beijing to loosen its grip on the besieged yuan need to be mindful of the risk that it unleashes a chain reaction rocking emerging- and developed-market currencies alike, according to some strategists.】

item.title: 澳大利亚重启对华关系，这些股票值得关注
item.description: 北京和堪培拉之间关系的改善使面临贸易限制的澳大利亚股票前景更加光明，葡萄酒制造商和一些农业部门被视为主要受益者。【原文：Improving relations between Beijing and Canberra are brightening the outlook for Australian stocks that have faced trade restrictions, with winemakers and some agricultural sectors seen as major beneficiaries.】
